result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yash K Patel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Yash K Patel
Current: 521 N 9th Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 02-27-2017)
Prior: 515 N 8th Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 2:27 p.m. 
**Includes 15CF3, 15CM5, 15CM35 & 15TR86**
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears with Attorney Lou Ann Bohn. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.  VRCW*
State moves to: 15CF3- Amend Ct.1 to 940.19(1) Misd. Battery & DRI Ct.2- Disorderly Conduct. 
                           15CM5- DRI Ct.2- Disorderly Conduct. 
                           15CM35- DRI Ct.1- Bail Jumping (Misd) 
                           15TR86- Failure to Yield Right of Way- Dismiss 
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 15CF3- Amended Ct.1 Misd. Battery>>GUILTY
           15CM5- Ct.1 Disorderly Conduct (Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty on 15CF3 Ct.1 & 15CM5 Ct.1. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CF3 Ct.1 & 15CM5 Ct.1: SWH- 1 year probation. CONDITIONS: Assessment and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, obtain high school diploma, attend school full-time as ordered by the school, defendant shall not obtain any new charges, 40 hours CS, no possession of firearms, no contact with S.E. or N.S. incidental contact by attending school is permitted, CC & DNA surcharge. 3 days credit if revoked. Defendant is eligible for expungment upon successful completion of probation. 
Adj: 2:41 p.m.
Pre-trial conference on February 5, 2015 at 09:50 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Pre-trial conference on January 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s):  N.S.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
